location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/63 Use of Sitrah as a harbour by steamers'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-3; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, Claud Cranbrook Lewis De Grenier, Director of Customs and Port Officer in Bahrain, and Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch, Political Agent, Bahrain. The correspondence concerns the use of Sitrah harbour by the Mesopotamia Persia Corporation steamer, SS Neunfels, without prior permission from the Government of Bahrain.Folio 6 is internal office notes.
